Quotations.ab: ēk ēn kū andar panjag tā wahištōišt kū hamispahmēdyam māh ī Spandarmad andar yazišn ud niyāyišn ud drōn yaštan nē šāyēd xwāndan čē ēn panj rōz az māh judāg dāšt estēd

čiyōn az abestāg ī niyādom paydāg āat̰ aētahē paṇca aiiara hamas[a]θmaiδəm paiti ratūm spəṇtaiiå armitōiš mā̊ŋhō nōit̰ frasrāuuaiiōit̰ ēdōn ān panj rōz hamispadmēdim abar radīh spandarmad bowandag-menišn māh kū spandarmad māh nē frāz srāyēd kū nē xwānēd čē agar az [framōšīh] abar xwānēd abestāg padīriftag nē bawēd.

"At the performance of the Yasna, the Niyāyišn and the Drōn, during the five days until Wahištōišt, i.e. at the Hamaspaϑmaēdaya, the one (performing) must nor recite the month Spandarmad, since these five days are separated from the month."

"As it is clear from the abastāg of the Niyādom āat̰ aētahē paṇca aiiara hamas[a]θmaiδəm paiti ratūm spəṇtaiiå armitōiš mā̊ŋhō nōit̰ frasrāuuaiiōit̰, i.e. 'so these five days, during the ratu of Hamaspaϑmaēdaya, Spandarmad of well-mindedness, i.e. the month Spandarmad, should not be recited', i.e. should not be read; if by forget, one recites it, the abastāg would not be acceptable."

ab.ab: Revāyat of Kama Bohra (MU1, p. 455) on the Yašt ī gāϑābiiō:
